page.title: 01Denbigh / Llanrhaedr Area
page.content: Our block contains most of the original{old walled town of Denbigh which is a{market town}serving an {agricultural}community situated centrally in the{Vale of Clwyd}12miles from the coast. On the West the ground rises to{Denbigh moors}and the{Brenig and{Snowdonia}regions with access through our area via the A543. Denbigh Castle on its rock stands out as a conspicious feature in the Vale to remind us of the town's historic past. From the castle walls a magnificent view of the Vale and{Clwydian hills unfolds as we gaze across a close network of fields and hedgerows and a liberal distribution of farm units. The A525 Ruthin - Rhyl Rd. sets the limits of these lower Valley hill slopes with land area intensively farmed and more land in permanent pasture than the valley bottom.
